member.name: T:Sudoku.Analytics.Chaining.ChainingRule
member.summary: Represents a rule that make inferences (strong or weak) between two instances.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Analytics.Chaining.ChainingRule.CollectStrongLinks(Sudoku.Concepts.Grid@,Sudoku.Concepts.LinkDictionary)
member.summary: Collects for strong links appeared in argument and insert all found values into argument .
member.param: The grid to be checked.
The collection of strong links, grouped by its node.
member.remarks: Consider adding values from both entries if a link is found. The method call is helpful.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Analytics.Chaining.ChainingRule.CollectWeakLinks(Sudoku.Concepts.Grid@,Sudoku.Concepts.LinkDictionary)
member.summary: Collects for weak links appeared in argument and insert all found values into argument .
member.param: The grid to be checked.
The collection of weak links, grouped by its node.

member.name: T:Sudoku.Concepts.Link

summary.para: Represents a link that describes a relation between two instances.

para.b: Please note that two instances will be considered as equal only if they holds same node values, regardless of what link type two instances use.

member.param: Indicates the first node to be used.
Indicates the second node to be used.
Indicates the type of the link.
Indicates the inference between two nodes and .

summary.para: Represents a link that describes a relation between two instances.

para.b: Please note that two instances will be considered as equal only if they holds same node values, regardless of what link type two instances use.

member.param: Indicates the first node to be used.

Indicates the inference between two nodes and .

member.name: M:Sudoku.Concepts.Link.Equals(Sudoku.Concepts.Link,Sudoku.Concepts.LinkComparison)
member.summary: Determine whether two are considered equal on the specified comparison rule.
member.param: The other object to be compared.
The comparison rule to be used.
member.exception: Throws when the argument is not defined.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Concepts.Link.Inference
member.summary: The generated property declaration for parameter inference.

member.name: T:Sudoku.Concepts.LinkComparison
member.summary: Represents a comparison rule to be used on comparing with two instances.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Concepts.LinkComparison.Undirected
member.summary: Indicates the comparing rule is undirected, which means two instances will be compared, without any direction checking; i.e. node1 -> node2 is equal to node2 -> node1. This is the default option on comparing.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Concepts.LinkComparison.Directed
member.summary: Indicates the comparing rule is directed, which means two instances will be compared, with considerations on direction; i.e. node1 -> node2 is not equal to node2 -> node1.

member.name: T:Sudoku.Concepts.LinkDictionary
member.summary: Represents a list of relations on strong or weak links.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Concepts.LinkDictionary.AddEntry(Sudoku.Concepts.Node,Sudoku.Concepts.Node)
member.summary: Add a link to the current collection with both entries on nodes of the link used.
member.param: Indicates the first node to be added.
Indicates the second node to be added.

member.name: T:Sudoku.Concepts.LinkType
member.summary: Represents a link type.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Concepts.LinkType.SingleDigit
member.summary: Indicates the link type is a single digit (X rule).

member.name: F:Sudoku.Concepts.LinkType.SingleCell
member.summary: Indicates the link type is a single cell (Y rule).

member.name: F:Sudoku.Concepts.LinkType.LockedCandidates
member.summary: Indicates the link type is a locked candidates.

member.summary: Indicates the link type is an almost locked set.

member.summary: Indicates the link type is an almost hidden set.

member.summary: Indicates the link type is a kraken normal fish.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Concepts.LinkType.AlmostUniqueRectangle
member.summary: Indicates the link type is an almost unique rectangle.
